column4: Hey is there a quick way to get into the console while your inside of a dir in the gui?
theres a nautilus extension you can install, "nautilus-open-terminal" is the package, that'll put it in your right click menu

httpd.conf isn't used in Ubuntu.  And, it's /etc/apache2/ since youre most likely usign that.  Ubuntu uses a few places for config.  apache2.conf for system wide things, then sites-available for site specific things, then mods-available for module specific config.  The stuff you're interested in will be in sites-available
I never said that.  I said the config stuff isn't in httpd.conf, but elsewhere.
That depends on what you're changing, like I said.  Either apache2.conf, /sites-available/* or /mods-available/*
.htpasswd is actually in your we folder.  /var/www
er, sorry.  Im thinking of something else
htpasswd will be put into your web dir though.  /var/www for example.
someone's told you how to install Java.  What are you talking about?
the java page had a link, but there's another one.
it's not.  The instructions are straight forward if you'd follow them step by step.
the instructions for adding Multiverse are in a link at the top of that page, right after it says "To install java, you'll need Multiverse"
Have you still not read that page?
or, any other method you want of package installation
